<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 613, 91]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will determine the mass of an object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 146, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 690, 123]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Figs. 1.1 and 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 515, 152]]<|/det|>
The spring has already been set up for you.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[225, 163, 727, 425]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[321, 438, 390, 457]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[561, 439, 631, 457]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 470, 181, 489]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 469, 720, 489]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the length \(l_0\) of the spring without any load.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 500, 873, 521]]<|/det|>
\[l_0 = ....................................................\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 530, 181, 549]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 530, 536, 549]]<|/det|>
Suspend the \(100\mathrm{g}\) mass from the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 560, 665, 580]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the stretched length \(l_{1}\) of the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 591, 875, 611]]<|/det|>
<form>l_1 = .......................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 624, 181, 643]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 623, 789, 643]]<|/det|>
Calculate the extension \(e_{1}\) of the spring using the equation \(e_{1} = (l_{1} - l_{0})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 670, 875, 689]]<|/det|>
<form>e_1 = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 707, 181, 726]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 705, 752, 734]]<|/det|>
Determine a value for \(k\) using the equation \(k = \frac{m}{e_1}\), where \(m = 100 \text{g}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 785, 876, 804]]<|/det|>
<form>k = ............................ unit ................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 505, 92]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 92, 888, 299]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 310, 510, 329]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 341, 181, 359]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 339, 875, 376]]<|/det|>
Place the object \(\mathbf{X}\) with its centre at the mark on the metre rule that is \(40.0 \text{cm}\) from the end resting on the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 387, 875, 422]]<|/det|>
Explain briefly how you made sure that the object was in the correct position. You may wish to use a diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[839, 556, 875, 576]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 588, 181, 607]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 588, 583, 607]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the length \(l_{2}\) of the spring.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 618, 871, 640]]<|/det|>
\[l_{2} = ....................................................\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 650, 178, 669]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 650, 801, 670]]<|/det|>
Remove the object \(\mathbf{X}\). Measure and record the new length \(l_{3}\) of the spring.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 680, 871, 701]]<|/det|>
\[l_{3} = ....................................................\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 712, 181, 732]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 712, 875, 732]]<|/det|>
Determine the change in the extension \(e_{2}\) for the mass at \(40.0 \text{cm}\), where \(e_{2} = (l_{2} - l_{3})\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 758, 871, 778]]<|/det|>
\[e_{2} = ....................................................\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 789, 181, 808]]<|/det|>
<label>(v)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 789, 875, 839]]<|/det|>
Calculate the mass \(M\) of the object \(\mathbf{X}\) using your answer to (a)(iv) and (b)(iv) and the equation \(M = k\left(\frac{e_2}{0.40}\right)\).
